availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p: I, William G. English residing in the City of Sacramento, in the County of Sacramento, in the State of California, appointed by the Governor of the State of Kentucky or Commissioner for the State of Kentucky, to take the proof and acknowledgment of deeds and other instruments, and to administer oaths, pursuant to the act of the Legislature of the said State, entitled "An act to authorize the appointment of Commissioners to take the proof and acknowledment of deeds and other instruments, and to administer oaths in other States and Territories, do solemnly swear that I will well and faithfully execute and perform the duties of such commissioner, under and by virtue of the laws of the State of Kentucky.
Taken and subscribed this 3d day of June in the year 1865 before me.

A. C. Bidwell Clerk
By James C. McDonough D C

Comr of Deeds
Oath of Wm G. English
filed 19 July 1865
